intro: Daucus hispidus var. tenuisectus, commonly known as the slenderleaf wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems with finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in rocky or arid environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
